Articles.Content: Hello! i am Necros the Necromancer! i got ksp about 2 weeks ago. i would appreciate some tips on escape ing sub orbit please:-)

Necromancy may prove to be a useful skill in KSP!

Escaping suborbit? Three stages. Booster, standard liquid engine, high isp/low thrust liquid engine. 

For more detailed guidance you can look at the [Getting into orbit tutorial](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:_How_to_Get_into_Orbit). The rocket they suggest in there seems to be far underpowered in my experience, but the guide itself works.

Welcome aboard!

Interesting name. Don't go necro'ing our old threads, now! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Welcome to KSP and the forums. See "Exploring The System" if you want to learn about vehicle design, otherwise check The Drawing Board for tutorials on all things Kerbal. Links in signature :-)

ETA: As a new player I'd also welcome your comments on "Induction To Construction", which I'm still writing - signature again for the link.

Here is a [written/illustrated walkthrough](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25008-How-to-reach-orbit-and-a-rocket-that-can-do-it-a-walkthrough-for-newbies-%28vARM%29) for reaching orbit, with an example ship you can download to fly it with. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
it's simple; moar boosters!!111!11! solves everything

A necromancer, huh? How fascinating. Have fun with Jeb!

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) And welcome to the forums. Have fun here!

Welcome to the forums! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Looks like the others have you mostly sorted out, but feel free to ask more questions if you still have 'em. As Pecan has already mentioned, you may also want to take a look at some of the tutorials and other resources included in the Drawing Board, which is conveniently linked through my signature; I try to collect something for everyone and everything, so hopefully you'll find something that might be useful, whether right now or for future missions.

Hope this helps!
